item.title: IRT From Scratch
item.description: Programming an IRT, 2Pl Model from Scratch (So You Donâ€™t Have to) I recently had a client that was looking to build a 2PL model from scratch. The 2PL describes the process through which someone gets a correct or incorrect response on a test. More specifically, the probability of person j providing a positive answer to item i is given by: \[Pr(Y_{ij} = 1| \theta) = exp(a_i(\theta_j - b_i)/(1 + exp(a_i(\theta_j - b_i))\] \[\theta \sim N(0, 1)\]
